meanings.definition: In a biased or prejudiced manner.
meanings.sent1: She tendentiously favored one candidate over the others during the debate.
meanings.sent2: The journalist reported the news tendentiously, only presenting one side of the story.
meanings.sent3: The cat tendentiously chose to sleep on the comfiest chair in the house.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches tendentiously reached towards the sunlight, seeking its warmth.
meanings.sent5: The student tendentiously focused on studying for the math test, ignoring other subjects.

meanings.definition: Showing a strong inclination towards a particular point of view.
meanings.sent1: The tendentious article only highlighted the benefits of the new product.
meanings.sent2: Her tendentious argument swayed many people to her way of thinking.
meanings.sent3: The tendentious squirrel hoarded all the nuts in the park for itself.
meanings.sent4: The tendentious river flowed steadily towards the ocean, never deviating from its path.
meanings.sent5: The tendentious painting captured the artist's strong emotions about the cityscape.
